Posts.Content: Hi Jenners, I go for my first fec, with cold cap next week, thank you for your post, it made me feel a bit better! I was going to try false eyelashes, but can see they may be difficult to stay on.....I saw nipple recon too amazing, and under local I think?
Posts.Title: Is the cold cap worth it and chemo questions

Posts.Content: Hi Congenial, so sorry to hear about yr husband.....I totally  agree its self protection and for me that of my kids......I feel guilty having any fleeting thoughts of withdrawing when my partner was diagnosd with tonsil cancer.I have to say I think you are amazing doing his driver and nursing needs, im in the nursing line of work, but too care for a loved one in that way is compleltly diffrent, I helped nurse my sister in laws husband at there home and although didnt no him very well found it the hardest thing.Thankfully my boyfriend is back at work...... like you I have hadmastectomy and on chemo  , he has been truely amazing.....i do worry that he may have same thoughts especially as he has just been through dreadful treatment......but i actually think it has bought us closer..... hugs too you x
Posts.Title: Relationship problems

Posts.Content: Hi Sasha and Kay, My partner was diagnosed with tonsil cancer at the begining of the year, (like you Sasha we dont live together due to children but its best for all.) I had fleeting thoughts of withdrawal......and thinking back I think it was due to my life long fears of cancer, having lost my mum to breast cancer when she was in her 30's ( iwas 12) and not wanting my son too see the side effects of treatment, (as I had for my mum) which were nasty for him. AS it was he was soooo brave, wanted time together and time alone, we expalained anything to my son and he was great with it.......my love for him grew more.......and he is now back at work.......he was a true inspiration.... As he got all clear I was diagnosed with breast cancer.....he has been amazing, with me and my sons....there when ever do what ever dont know what id do without him. The ways i supported him were, just being there, ;istening.helping with house work, cooking, love,comfort, phoning chemo unit of his behalf ( he wouldnt trouble people) taking to appointments when he didnt insist on walking or going on bike! visiting in hosp, taking high cal things I thought he may tolerate and taste. He has no family here but good friends who were very good too/ If you dont mind me asking.....was yr partners tumor a lymph node.....thats how they founf my b/fs tonsil cancer xx Jo x
Posts.Title: Relationship problems

Posts.Content: Hi I am positive too all 3, I had 4th chemo weds first Tax ( other 3 fec)with  1st Herceptin, have been told, that tamoxifen starts with rads for me once chemo finished, I am premenopause ......x
Posts.Title: Herceptin AND Tamoxifen at the same time?

Posts.Content: Thank you Nianne, its good to know that the memory goes, how are you doing now?? I worry due to leg aches , dr thinks is nothing as only 2 lymph nodes affected....but has done a bone scan to reassure......dont feel reassured waiting for results x
Posts.Title: Had a melt down! Thanks for listening to my sound off!

Posts.Content: Hi all, had 4 th chemo have been admitted 3 times with high temp despite GCSF............came home last night, everything got on top of me,  fear , anxiety, unable to cope with son and relying on everyone else.....will i ever get through.......I had totallly melt down........felt better after,I still ache after 1st tax (how long does thatl ast)?? I constanatly worry as temp always a little over 37 and need analgesia but dare not take as temp could be on its way up and then I mask signs of infection, phewwww..........carthartic post xxx
Posts.Title: Had a melt down! Thanks for listening to my sound off!

Posts.Content: THANK YOU for your replies it  REALLYdoes help, as makes me realise its normal, sometimes my temp has been under 37.5 but have been neutropenic, its the uncertaintity,Im not concerned about the actual temperature its the worry I may be neutopenic  which the temp indicates as so dangerous, and as a singe parent  itis a juggling act getting   kids sorted, in the night or when ever.my temp is now 37.4, took only one brufen for joints aches and have rung chemo unit re something not to mask temperature, they suggested diclofenac, so will call gp for that.! Just spoke to gp who says diclofenac is same group as brufen!!!! your right polly cat, apart from start of journey this is is the first time ive broken down ( which surprises me)  Tax is emotionally gruelling, had had enough last night, all the uncertainty and having to rely on others really got to me.....hoping these aches go soon, im a week post tax? x
Posts.Title: Had a melt down! Thanks for listening to my sound off!

Posts.Content: gp just rung back!!!! she said when she went to prescribe diclofenac, she had a huge alert on her screen, as im on fluoxitine higer risk of bleeding!!! Gp suggests asking for more reguar blood tests.........shhesssh!
Posts.Title: Had a melt down! Thanks for listening to my sound off!

Posts.Content: Hi, I had a slight sore throat wih temp of only 37.4, WBC/neutrophils were 0.2 and had to be admitted, fortunately results were back up for chemo today to 4.5. Dispute vague sore throat I didnt feel unwell and was shocked i had to go in. If i hadnt of checked my temp Id of either become really unwell or, like you (possibly) had chemo delayed. They have now givenme injections to administer, that should stimulate white blood cell production. There isnt anything you can do to help boost it unfortunatley, hopefully they will come back up and chemo will go ahead as planned x
Posts.Title: Pre chemo blood results are low

Posts.Content: Hiya, I had first fec 10 days ago and tried thecold cap so its too early to say yet, next treatment 3rd oct so I can let you no more then, I have known others too use it and met a lady on chemo ward , all of whos hair thinned but kept most of it. The cap did give me a   headache , i did tremble with cold afterand hour or so. and i kept tightening it up till  I was nearly garotted!! I wasnt told to wear a special conditioner before tho, interested in knowing how that may help??
Posts.Title: A Cold cap - did it work for you?

Posts.Content: Hi Sascha. I always thought red wine was a no no for breast cancer, but good for heart disease? Id like to know, as although dont like red wine i could do a glass on a night out if reduces risk as  I have been abstaining from alcohol due to 'cancer thrives on sugar'........ i too was refused double mx initially as they want to treat affected side first, but my surgeon will do prophaltic mx when treatment to right side down, he has organised me councelling prior to procedure xxx
Posts.Title: Chances of recurrence

Posts.Content: Thanks for your replys, Maybe all is not lost although hair very thin, good to here some eyebrows and lashes remain for you......thats given me a great discussion for next thread! Thanks again ladies x
Posts.Title: Anyone had hair regrowth between cycles Fec and T?

Posts.Content: Hell, Ive used cold cap for 2 FECs, but  have got big Bald patches, I just read and old post on this site, where a lady said, her hair started to regrow when changing between FEC and T, I just wondered if anyone else has experienced this or any other hair regrowth,.......just trying to weigh up if to carry on with the cold cap, worth ago if possibly starts to regrow despite pain of cap .......thanks for replies ladies xx
Posts.Title: Anyone had hair regrowth between cycles Fec and T?

Posts.Content: LOL , Im a cat person too! Thats reassuring thanks for posting, my hair is now so thin, but maybe if it starts growing a little its worth perservering, and hopefully regrowth will appear faster if a lttle there! loads comes out in comb tho :-\ x
Posts.Title: Anyone had hair regrowth between cycles Fec and T?

Posts.Content: Hi Amy, Hope your chemo went ok and your not suffering to many nasty side effects, I have met several young girls with breast cancer but nearer 30 than 24. I hope you found the unit to be friendy , I usually try to get chatting and have made a few friends excahnged numbers etc......... I friend requested you, if you want to chat, im very young at heart so im told :P  lol x
Posts.Title: chemo day 2moro

Posts.Content: Hi  Kev taxi, Im nr Broomefield and no hospital fairly well my mother in law had her mastectomy and reconstruction there,and would have gone there , but as had silicone implant had surgery at Colchester x
Posts.Title: home after masectomy

Posts.Content: Thanks for your replies ladies, i got up and did jobs as had a surge of energy and no tomorrow I well maynot have any, back for a nap now!! Jox
Posts.Title: Feeling hot and nights sweats anyone....

Posts.Content: Yes please let me no Judy, I know I need the steroids with tax particularly, as had bad reactions to fec , going neutropenic etc etc,and iv hydrocortisne is steroid, ....ive never had burning cheeks, but i do at the mo!!temp always sits just over 37  as a result....... just realised my next dose is 2 days prior to yrs on the weds, , still let me no for my final dose!! x
Posts.Title: Feeling hot and nights sweats anyone....

Posts.Content: Hi all, I used to be such a cold mortal before statring chemo, now i seem to get night sweats and even in the day, feel my face flush, sometimes is due to low grade temperature, (have been neutropenic).....but just had first Tax and woke to nights very swteay, is ths normal?? Im assuming Im up at the crack of dawn due to steroids.....or could they cause night sweats??  Thanks Jo x
Posts.Title: Feeling hot and nights sweats anyone....

Posts.Content: Hi, I became neutropenic on 2 of my FEc treatments despite gcsf injections, had first doceytaxol yesterday, and they reduced dose by 20%, I asked the question "will it work" they assure me that it will, its still with in the limits, they just doent want to keep making me ill , as T makes many more people neutropenic than fec , and has a list of other nasty side effects they hope too reduce too , Jo x
Posts.Title: Reduction in Docetaxal/Tax has anyone else had this? Will it still...
